1775520293525524948.text: currently creating a blizzard moment for our sci-fi game.   which color scheme do you prefer?   chromatic black & white  saturated blue
replies: the deep blue is more beautiful, but it doesn't feel as "cold" for some reason.  it comes off as more like warm water  i read someone else say a desaturated blue, that might be the ticket, and keep the heavy dark shadows from the gray scale one:

both look great, but i'd rather play through blue. the black and white version makes it feel like the player is weary from a long journey and every step is a struggle. the blue one has a sense of being surrounded by magic and moving towards something mysterious.
which colour is your current smartphone?

consider adding a splash of bright color where the player is. then the b&w version doesnt look so old timey and it evokes a sense of isolation. like a lighthouse in a storm. doing the same with the blue version doesnt work as well because of the contrast. keep us posted on the
im all about that blue, but how difficult is it to have a b&w mode for the game though? those visuals look great!
if there was a recent dramatic moment in the story then the b&w works well. otherwise, go for the blue.
